segments.text: Looking into this kitchen, everything seems so ordinary at first.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The woman is polishing that plate, her apron tied neatly.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: But the faucet is running full blast, and the sink is full to the brim.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Water's spilling everywhere, soaking the cabinets and floor.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: She's oblivious, just standing there with one foot in the mess.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Those kids over by the cabinets are up to no good.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The boy is on that unstable stool, stretching for the cookie jar.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: He's got a plate in one hand, probably to hold the cookies.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The girl is helping him, her arm up like she's begging for treats.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: This is so irresponsible; they could fall and get hurt.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The puddle is getting bigger, and someone might slip.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Why isn't anyone paying attention to all this chaos?
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The outside garden is calm, but inside it's a disaster waiting.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I can't believe they're sneaking cookies like that.
segments.speaker: PAR
